subject: Your daily e-mail from the BBC
body:
Saturday, 19 May, 2007, 18:00 GMT 14:00 -04:00:Canada/Eastern














Search BBC Sport 













FOOTBALL




Chelsea 1-0 Manchester United
A Didier Drogba goal in extra time is enough to win Chelsea the first FA Cup final at the new Wembley Stadium.



 
Mourinho treasures FA Cup medal
Chelsea boss Jose Mourinho says his FA Cup winner's medal means a lot to him.



 
We were denied penalty - Ferguson
Man Utd boss Sir Alex Ferguson said his team were denied a clear penalty in the FA Cup final defeat by Chelsea.








GOLF




Harrington three ahead in Ireland
Padraig Harrington will take a three-shot lead into the final round of the Irish Open at Adare Manor.



 
AT&T Classic leaderboard




 
Irish Open leaderboard
The latest scores from the European Tour event at Adare Manor.








MOTORSPORT




Edwards rockets to Le Mans pole
Yamaha's Colin Edwards will start the French MotoGP on pole after setting a new lap record at Le Mans.



 
Loeb maintains lead in Sardinia
French star Sebastien Loeb leads after day two of the Rally of Italy in Sardinia.



 
Rally of Italy positions
Leading positions from the World Rally Championship event.








FORMULA ONE




Mosley steps up push for green F1
Formula One boss Max Mosley is proposing a raft of changes to help accelerate the adoption of "green" technology.



 
Hamilton won't win title - Jordan
Former team boss Eddie Jordan says Lewis Hamilton is an "extraordinary talent" but will not be world champion this year.



 
Hamilton will set 'new standards'
Lewis Hamilton will "create the new benchmark for Formula One", according to three-time champion Jackie Stewart.








ATHLETICS




Holmes tipping Pavey for success
Kelly Holmes feels Jo Pavey will prove her road-running credentials in Sunday's Great Manchester Run.



 
GB trio shine in Great Wall test
Britain has three top-10 finishers in China's Great Wall Marathon as Salvador Calvo smashes the record in one of the world's toughest 26-mile races.



 
UK to host landmark running event
The first-ever Commonwealth ultra running championships will be held in the UK in 2009.








CYCLING




Petacchi takes Giro seventh stage
Italy's Alessandro Petacchi of the Milram team wins the seventh stage of the Giro d'Italia from Spoleto to Scarperia.



 
Blackmail claim stuns Landis case
Floyd Landis sacks his business manager after he allegedly tried to expose the fact Greg LeMond had been a victim of child abuse.



 
Laverde grabs Giro stage victory
Colombia's Luis Felipe Laverde wins the sixth stage of the Giro d'Italia from Tivoli to Spoleto.

KP's rough guide to Britain
